Sinclair Transportation Company

Denver Products Terminal



RMP EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



At the Sinclair Transportation Company Denver Products Terminal in Henderson, CO, we are committed to providing a safe work environment for employees and to being a responsible corporate citizen. We believe that excellent performance in the areas of health, environment, safety and security goes hand-in-hand with operational excellence and financial success. In fulfilling this commitment, we will comply with regulatory requirements and provide and maintain a safe working environment using acceptable and proven business practices. All Sinclair Transportation Company employees will strive to identify and eliminate hazards which could result in injury and illness, damage to the environment, property damage, and security losses.



The Denver Products Terminal is operated and maintained in a manner that protects the environment, as well as the health and safety of our employees, contractors and the community in which we operate. We promote health, safety, and the environment through programs of awareness, compliance, prevention and protection.  These programs include a combination of accidental release prevention and emergency response planning.  This summary provides a brief overview of the risk management activities that we have designed and implemented.



STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES



Sinclair Transportation Company, Denver Products Terminal is a light products, bulk petroleum storage facility used in the storage and distribution of petroleum products to retail and commercial end-users in the vicinity of Henderson, Colorado. The Terminal handles and stores various grades of unleaded gasoline, low-sulfur diesel, renewable fuels (i.e. ethanol, biodiesel, etc.) and additives.  The Denver Product Terminal complies with Process Safety Regulations in the covered process which encompasses Butane unloading, Butane storage vessels, pumps and associated piping.  Butane is stor

ed in two vessels and transferred to/blended with gasoline (pipeline injection) through the use of a fixed piping system and blending skid.

GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAMS



Our accidental release prevention programs and emergency planning and response programs help us effectively manage the hazards posed by our regulated substances to our employees, the public, and the environment. The covered process is regulated by the EPA RMP regulation 40 CFR Part 68 and the OSHA Process Safety Management Standard 29CFR 1910.119. The following accident prevention programs are in place at the Denver Products Terminal:

1) Employee Participation

2) Process Safety Information

3) Process Hazard Analysis (PHA) 

4) Standard Operating Procedures

5) Operator Training

6) Contractors

7) Pre-startup Safety Review

8) Mechanical Integrity 

9) Work Authorization

10) Management of Change

11) Incident Investigation

12) Emergency Procedures

13) Compliance Audits

14) Trade Secrets



FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



There have been no accidents within the past five (5) years.



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM



Our Emergency Response Plan provides the essential planning and training for protecting employees, the public, and the environment during emergency situations. Contained within the Plan are written procedures that outline the actions to be taken for various types of emergencies that could occur in the facility.  These emergencies may include: airborne releases of chemical substances, spills to the water or ground, fires, explosions, personnel medical emergencies. 



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY



We are continually striving to make the Denver Products Terminal the safest and most reliable workplace possible for our employees, our neighbors and our community. The facility's focus is safe, reliable, and environmentally sound operations. The goal of the Denver Products Terminal is to demonstrate continuous improvement in our health, environmental and safety per
formance. In addition, we will work cooperatively with our neighbors to ensure the health, environment, safety and security of the Denver Products Terminal and surrounding community.
